title: Create Category Level Promos
contentSummary: Learn how to create category-level promotions for specific items and configure settings like discount type, time, and date range.
instructions: Navigate to Items > Categories to open the Categories screen.
Select a category or create a new one.
Enable the 'On Sale' checkbox to display the pricing options.
Enter required fields such as Buy, Promo, and applicable discount details.
Set optional fields: Max Per Transaction, Start/End Dates, Time, and Days of the Week.
Save the settings to activate the promo.

promoTypes.description: Discount a specific dollar amount per item.
Purchase required items to get one free.

promoTypes.type: Buy One Get One Half Price
promoTypes.description: Purchase required items to get another at 50% off.

examplePromos.title: TGIF Special
examplePromos.details: Buy one appetizer, get one 50% off all day Friday.

examplePromos.title: Seasonal Hair Care Sale
examplePromos.details: All hair care products discounted to $3.99.

examplePromos.title: Salon Services Promo
examplePromos.details: Purchase one nail service, get the second for 20% off.

title: How to Use Promos
contentSummary: Learn how to create and manage promotions, including BOGOs, Happy Hour specials, and more. Promos are applied automatically or manually at the register.

promoTypes.description: Discount a single item or when multiple of the same item are purchased.
Apply discounts to all items in a category.
Apply discounts to items within a subcategory.
Discount a combination of specific items across categories or subcategories.

features.name: Happy Hour Specials
features.description: Layer times and values onto promos for specific hours.

features.name: Service Promos
features.description: Promos can be created for services as easily as for items.

instructions: Navigate to Settings > Register Preferences > Promos tab to configure promo preferences.
Promos are applied automatically at checkout but can also be applied manually at the register.
Enable Auto Refresh Promo to display the Refresh Promo button for automatic updates.
notes: Promos are different from discounts. Promos apply automatically; discounts are applied manually.
Services are treated as items for promo creation.

title: Create Item Level Promos
contentSummary: Set up promotions for individual items, such as discounts or BOGO deals, during specific times and dates.

examples.title: Liquor Store
examples.details: Buy one 18-pack of Bud Light Anniversary, get a second pack at 50% off on Fridays in July.

examples.title: Spa
examples.details: Motherâ€™s Day Special: 25% off a 50-minute Swedish Massage for two weeks before Mother's Day.

examples.title: Bakery or Market Deli
examples.details: Pumpkin Pie on sale for $6.99 (regular $10.99) during the second and third week of November.

instructions: Navigate to Items > Item List.
Search or scroll to find the item and open its details.
Tap the Promos tab and enable the On Sale slider.
Enter promo details such as Buy, Promo Type, Max Per Transaction, and applicable dates and times.
Tap Save to activate the promo.

promoSettings.description: Number of items required to qualify for the promo.
Type of promotion, such as dollar amount off or percentage off.
Maximum quantity a customer can purchase to qualify for the promo.
Optional start and end dates for the promotion.
Optional start and end times for the promotion.
Days of the week when the promotion is active.

bulkSetup.overview: Apply promos to groups of items or services by creating temporary lists and configuring promo settings.
steps: Create a temporary list using Advanced Item Search or Advanced Services Search.
Apply filters and select Modify All List Items or Modify All List Services.
Enable the On Sale checkbox and configure promo settings as needed.
Confirm changes to activate promos for the selected items or services.

title: Mark a Purchase Order as Paid
contentSummary: Learn how to mark purchase orders as Paid using the Exatouch system. This action applies to Open, Open Sent, Pending, and Completed purchase orders.
instructions: Find and open or create a purchase order.
Tap 'Paid' to mark the purchase order as paid.
Tap 'Yes' to confirm. Note: This change cannot be undone.
Take other non-payment related actions, if needed.

relatedTopics.title: Mark a Purchase Order as Complete and Inventory as Received

notes: Registered internal users can comment on this topic.
Merchants are encouraged to provide suggestions for improvement.

title: Create a Purchase Order
contentSummary: Learn how to create purchase orders by selecting items to reorder from a vendorâ€™s supply list or adding new items directly. This guide also covers dynamic reordering and adding new vendors or items to inventory.
instructions: Navigate to Home > Purchasing > PO Details.
Search for a vendor using the search icon or scroll through the vendor list.
Select a vendor to display their supply list.
Toggle between 'Vendor Items' and 'All Items' to choose items to reorder.
Tap an item to add it to the purchase order, or tap 'Insert All' to add all items.
Edit the default quantity and cost fields as needed, then tap OK to confirm.
Tap 'Close' once all items have been added to the purchase order.
Set Received and Expected dates if necessary.
Enter sales tax, if applicable.
Finish the purchase order by tapping Print, Save, or Send.

examples.title: Add a New Vendor
examples.details: Tap 'New Vendor' if the vendor isnâ€™t in your list. Enter the vendorâ€™s information and tap Save.

examples.title: Add a New Item to Inventory
examples.details: Tap 'Add New Item', enter the itemâ€™s details, and tap Save. The item is added to inventory and linked to the vendor.

examples.title: Add Coffee to a Vendor Supply List
examples.details: Switch to 'All Items', search for coffee, and select it. Tap Yes to add it to the purchase order and vendor supply list.

notes: Default quantity and cost fields may be populated based on item details, previous orders, or dynamic reordering settings.
Dynamic reordering calculates the quantity using Safe Qty if enabled. If no saved information is available, default values are Quantity: 1.00, Cost: $0.00.

relatedTopics.title: Email a PO to a Vendor
Low Level Quantities in the Register

title: Create Subcategory Level Promos
contentSummary: Set up promotions for items within a subcategory, allowing discounts to be applied during specific hours or time periods. Users can also apply promos to parent categories, affecting all child subcategories.
instructions: Navigate to Home > Items > Categories.
Select a Category or Subcategory from the list.
Activate the On Sale checkbox to enable the sale pricing work area for the selected Subcategory.
Enter the required number of items in the Buy field to qualify for the promo.
Select a promo type from the drop-down menu and configure details like dollar amount or percentage off.
Optional: Enter a maximum number of promos per transaction in the Max Per Trx field.
Optional: Define the Start Date, End Date, Start Time, and End Time for the promotion.
Enable at least one day of the week for the promo to run.
Tap Save to activate the promo for the selected Subcategory.

examples.title: New Yearâ€™s Special
examples.details: Liquor Store: 10% off all Champagne selections during the last week of December.

examples.title: Deep Conditioning Wednesdays
examples.details: Salon and Spa: Buy two Moroccan Oil Treatments, get one more free every Wednesday in February.

examples.title: TGIFries-Day Special
examples.details: Restaurant: Purchase any type of fries for $2.00 on Fridays from 4 p.m. â€“ 9 p.m.

notes: Promos with an end date or time will expire automatically but can be deactivated manually at any time.
Discounts apply to the lowest-priced item sold as part of the promotion.
Admins can modify promo display settings in Register Preferences.

title: Menu Building for Restaurants
contentSummary: Learn how to build menus in Exatouch for restaurants, including creating categories, subcategories, items, and modifiers. This guide also covers organizing modifiers and assigning them efficiently to root items.
instructions: Navigate to Home > Items > Categories to create categories and subcategories.
Tap 'New Category' to create a new category, enter a description, and select a category type (Items or Services). Tap Save.
Select a category, then tap 'New Subcat' to create subcategories. Enter a description and tap Save.
Navigate to Home > Items > Item Details to create root items.
Enter a SKU, item name, price, category, and subcategory for the item. Tap Save.
Verify proper tax rates are enabled by adjusting settings in the Tax & GL tab.
To create modifiers, navigate to Home > Items > Item Details, tap 'New', and enter details like SKU, modifier name, price, and category/subcategory. Toggle the Modifier slider and tap Save.
Attach modifiers to root items from the Items List screen or via subcategories for faster menu building.
Organize modifiers into groups for easier selection in the Register app. Use the 'Manage Group' function to define minimum and maximum modifiers per group.

examples.title: Attach Modifiers Individually
examples.details: From the Item Details screen, tap the Modifiers tab, add a new modifier, and tap Save. Repeat for more modifiers.

examples.title: Group Modifiers for Efficiency
examples.details: Select a category and subcategory in the Modifiers tab. Use the Subcategory arrow to attach modifiers to an item. Tap Save.

examples.title: Organize Modifier Groups
examples.details: Use 'Manage Group' to rename groups, set minimum and maximum modifiers, and allow flexibility in the Register app.

notes: Use the Categories module to organize items and services for easier access in the Register app.
Modifiers can represent extra costs or additions to an item (e.g., extra cheese, bacon).
Modifier Price defines the charge applied in the Register, while Price represents inventory value.
Verify 'Manage Group' settings to ensure modifiers behave as intended in the Register app.

title: Modify Inventory Levels
content:
Last Updated: 
					    				June 8, 2023
Compatible Version: 8.286+Does your Exatouch look different? View prior release â†’
Inventory levels for your items are maintained by Exatouch: every sale, return, inventory count, and shipment acceptance affects your on-hand stock. Adjust quantity levels for single items outside of these workflows in Item Details.
Edit an item record directly to add or remove inventory outside of the usual retail workflows of selling, buying, and inventory maintenance.
From Home, navigate to Items > Item List.
Select an item. The Item Details screen displays.
Tap the Inventory tab.
In the Stock Type section, perform one of the following:
Inventory Item: Tap to enable inventory tracking.
Non-Inventory: Tap to disable inventory tracking.
Tap Save.


Merchants can adjust inventory either under the Inventory Adjustment tab or within the Items Count submodule.
From the Item Details screen, tap the Inventory Adjustment tab.
To increase item quantity, perform the following:
In the Qty To Add field, enter the number of items to add.
Enter an Adjustment Reason in the workspace (e.g., Received a new shipment).
Note: If you do enter an Adjustment Reason, Exatouch prompts you to do so. The reason for an inventory change displays in inventory reports.
Tap Save.
To decrease item quantity, perform the following:
In the Qty To Remove field, enter the number of items to remove.
Enter an Adjustment Reason in the workspace (e.g., Returned a surplus).
Tap Save.
From Home, navigate to Items > Count.
On the Items Count screen, tap Add Items. The Item List screen displays.
Scan the item(s) or on the Item List screen, or tap the item the desired number of times, then tap Close. For example, tap the item five times to add five items.
Note: Users can also manually enter items.
The item displays on the Item Count screen, and the quantity added displays in the Qty column.
Tap Save to save your progress.
Repeat steps 2-5 as desired. When finished, tap Reconcile.
Tap Yes to confirm. The Reconciled Items screen displays.

Tip! On the Reconciled Items screen, users can remove an item after itâ€™s been reconciled by performing the following:

After reconciling an item, the Reconciled Items screen displays.
Deselect an itemâ€™s checkbox in the Selected column.
Enter a reason for reversing the item reconciliation in the Note field.
Tap Process.
Tap Yes to confirm.

After reconciling an item, the Reconciled Items screen displays.
Deselect an itemâ€™s checkbox in the Selected column.
Enter a reason for reversing the item reconciliation in the Note field.
Tap Process.
Tap Yes to confirm.


Merchants can track inventory trends over time by reviewing the Inventory Audit and Inventory Movement reports.
From Home, navigate to Reports > Items.
Tap Inventory Audit.
Select a date range from the Range drop-down menu, then tap Run.
The Inventory Audit report displays.
From Home, navigate to Reports > Items.
Tap Inventory Movement.
Tap the magnifying glass icon next to the Item field. The Item List screen displays.
Select an item to add, then tap OK.
Select a date range from the Range drop-down menu, then tap Run.
The Inventory Movement report displays.

title: Modify Items In Bulk
content:
Last Updated: 
					    				July 15, 2023
Compatible Version: 8.286+Does your Exatouch look different? View prior release â†’
Save time and effort by quickly modifying groups of items in bulk. Change prices, categories, and more. Create a list of items using advanced search, then use Modify All List Items to make your changes.
Note: Changes in federal banking regulations may result in adjustments to the EBT, dual pricing, and tender discount features.

Many Modify All List Items settings utilize sliders that operate according to a three-way toggle system. Tapping the slider the desired number of times toggles it between inactive, active (disabled), and active (enabled). By default, the sliders display as inactive. The following table describes the various slider settings.


FromÂ Home, navigate toÂ ItemsÂ >Â Item List.
On the Items List page, tap Advanced Item Search.
Select the desired filters from the pop-up screen, then tap Search.
Review search results, then tap Modify All List Items.Warning: Group items together using the Advanced Item Search button before using the Modify All List Items feature.
Warning: Group items together using the Advanced Item Search button before using the Modify All List Items feature.
In the work area that displays, enter any revisions as desired, then tap OK. In this example, the merchant configures Exatouch to make all seafood items non-refundable.
Confirm and re-confirm any changes. Tap No to abort the function.
Select any item in your temporary group of items to view your changes in the itemâ€™s record.
Scroll through your group of items by tapping one of the following:
First Item: Displays first item in group
Prev Item: Displays previous item in group
Next Item: Displays next item in group
Last Item: Displays last item in group
All Items: Displays all items in Exatouch


Note: Service Items can also be modified in bulk. See: Modify Bulk Services

Apply price changes in bulk. Increase or decrease the price of a group of items by dollar amount or by percentage.

Example: Â Raise prices by a percentage amount â€“  A retailer offers cash discounts of 3.5% on in-house brand items and wants to adjust pricing to reflect cash prices. 

Begin by grouping all applicable in-house brands.
In the Modify All List Items work area, enter 3.50 in the Price field.
Tap the slider until it toggles toward the plus sign (+) setting.
Select the percentage (%) bubble.

Begin by grouping all applicable in-house brands.
In the Modify All List Items work area, enter 3.50 in the Price field.
Tap the slider until it toggles toward the plus sign (+) setting.
Select the percentage (%) bubble.



Example:  Lower prices by a dollar amount â€“  A liquor store gets a large discount from their new provider of beer kegs and lowers its retail price by 5%. The store offers cash discounts and wants to adjust pricing to reflect cash prices.

Begin by grouping affected items in the Keg category.
In the Modify All List Items work area, enter 5.00 in the Price field.
Tap the slider until it toggles toward the minus (-) setting.
Select the dollar sign ($) bubble.

Begin by grouping affected items in the Keg category.
In the Modify All List Items work area, enter 5.00 in the Price field.
Tap the slider until it toggles toward the minus (-) setting.
Select the dollar sign ($) bubble.




Merchants can also apply promotions quickly and easily to grouped items. After creating a group, navigate to the Modify All List Items work area and tap the Promo tab. Set up and apply your promotion to your grouped items as you would for a single item.

Note: Depending on your Exatouch configuration, not all fields may be available.

Configure the following, as desired:
Exclude From Discounts: Enable or disable to exclude an item group from discounts.
Allow Discount: Enable or disable to define the item groupâ€™s discount status.
Exclude From Promotions: Enable or disable to exclude an item group from promotions.
Allow Promotions: Enable or disable to define the item groupâ€™s promotion status.
On Sale: Select to enable discount and promotion settings.
Buy: Enter the amount of items a customer must purchase to qualify for discounts/promotions.
Promo: Select the desired promotion from the drop-down menu.
Max Per Trx: Enter the maximum amount of the item a customer can buy per transaction (e.g., a merchant may limit quantities sold to prevent the item from selling out too quickly.)
Start Date: Select the date the discount/promotion begins.
End: Select the date the discount/promotion ends.

Tip! Select specific dates for when the discount/promotion is applied by selecting the appropriate checkbox. For example, select Tue and Thu to offer the discount/promotion on Tuesdays and Thursdays only. Default: All.

Daily Time Start: Select the time the discount begins.
End: Select the time the discount/promotion ends.
Exclusive For: Select the desired club membership level(s) to receive club discounts/promotions.
Promotions: Select the desired promo layers and add a discount/promotion price for each item group.
Promo 2: Select to enable and enter promo layer for Promo 2.
Promo 3: Select to enable and enter promo layer for Promo 3.
Promo 4: Select to enable and enter promo layer for Promo 4.

Note: See Happy Hour Specials: Use Promo Layers for details on creating promo layers.
Note: Historical Pricing can be applied to groups of items. See: Historical Pricing.

Tip! You can also apply promotions quickly and easily to your grouped items. Create your group, then navigate to Modify All List Items > Promo tab. Set up and apply your promotion to your grouped items as you would for a single item.



Note: Historical pricing can be applied toÂ groupÂ of items. See:Â Historical Pricing.

title: Find an Item
content:
Last Updated: 
					    				March 12, 2024
Compatible Version: 8.286+Does your Exatouch look different? View prior release â†’
Use the Register app to search for an item and add it to an order. Users with appropriate access levels can find items to get more information about an item, add or remove inventory for an item, or make individual or bulk make changes to items.

Tap the Find Items button in the Register app to open an item search area.
Use the various search options to narrow your results.
Tap an item to add it to your existing order.
Alternatively, tapÂ Insert All to add all items returned by your search to the order.
Tap theÂ Find Items button in the Order Details work area to open an item search area.
Use the various search options to narrow your results.
Tap an item to add it to your existing order.
Alternatively, tapÂ Insert All to add all items returned by your search to the order.
Use the search tools find your item. Simply scroll through the list of items or your listed search results using the green arrows, or narrow the item list by using one or more search filters.
Search: Tap a column heading to search for items based on information in that column. Enter a full or partial search term in the Search field to return matching results.

Example: Tap theÂ Size column and enterÂ 20 fl ozÂ in theÂ Search field to return matching items.

Filter by Category and Subcategory: Select a category and subcategory to restrict a search to items in those categories.

Example: Select the Category Beverages and the Subcategory Iced Teas to look through or Search for items in those categories.

Enable OnlyÂ modifiersÂ to restrict your search to items defined as modifiers.

As an added convenience, tap Add New Item to add a new item to Exatouch. A managerâ€™s PIN may be required.


From Home, navigate to Items > Item List to view inventory and menu items.
Scroll to find and tap an item to see the itemâ€™s details.
Use search tools to find specific items.


Note: Users with appropriate access levels can find items to get more information about an item, add or remove inventory for an item, or make individual or bulk make changes to items.



Scroll through the list of items or your listed search results using the green arrows, or narrow the item list by using one or more search filters.
Search: Tap a column heading to search for items based on information in that column. Enter a full or partial search term in the Search field to return matching results.

Example: Tap theÂ Size column and enterÂ 6 pkÂ in theÂ Search field to return matching items.




Note: Users with appropriate access levels can find items to get more information about an item, add or remove inventory for an item, or make individual or bulk make changes to items.


Advanced Item Search allows you to look for items that meet one or more specific requirements. Tap Advanced Item Search to open up a new advanced search work area.

Enter a full or partial term in theÂ Search Key: field, and select one or more options to narrow your search from your entire inventory to a smaller group of items.
All fields are optional; you can design your search to return items that meet one or more selections.

Search Key: Enter a full or partial term. If left blank, you can return items based on the other search options you select.
Category â€“ Select a category of items to search, such as Entrees or Floral.
Subcategory â€“ Select a subcategory of items to search, such as Pasta, Burgers, Cut Flowers, or Holiday Arrangements. You must also select a category.
Price:Â  Enter a retail price in dollars and cents (such as 5.99).
Size: Select a size, if used, from size types you use for your items to search, such as 16 fl oz,Â 6 pk,Â dozen,Â 222 ml,Â medium, orÂ one size.
Color: Select a color, if used, from the colors you use for your items to search, such asÂ Red, Blue, or Rainbow.
Style:Â Select a style, if used, from the styles you use for your items to search, such asÂ Child,Â Unisex,Â Cat, orÂ Bird.
Rev. Center: Select a Revenue Center from those defined for your business.
Rev. Class:Â Select a Revenue Class from those defined for your business.
Manufacturer: Select a Manufacturer from those assigned to your items to search.
Mfg Part: Enter a part number, if assigned, to your items to search.
Default Item Field â€“ Select a custom field, if used and assigned, to your items to search. This field may have a different name based on your Exatouch settings.
Custom Field 2 â€“ Select a custom field, if used and assigned, to your items to search. This field may have a different name based on your Exatouch settings.
Custom Field 3 â€“ Select a custom field, if used and assigned, to your items to search. This field may have a different name based on your Exatouch settings.
Vendor: Select a Vendor from those assigned to your items to search.
Need To Reorder â€“ Enable to restrict results to items that have reached their defined low level quantity.
Select your search parameters, then tap Search to find your items.
Example: Search for items in theÂ CategoryÂ Beverages and enableÂ Need To Reorder. Exatouch returns all BeveragesÂ items that need to be reordered.



TapÂ Clear Search Results to clear your search results when you are done working with item search and adjustments.
TapÂ Modify All List Items to make specific changes to all items returned by your search.
TapÂ Print List to print a list of your search results.
Tap Report to open a report work area. Generate reports based on your search results.
Note: Users with appropriate access levels can find items to get more information about an item, add or remove inventory for an item, or make individual or bulk make changes to items.


Switch to searching for an item or groups of items at any time while you work in the Items Detail work area.
TapÂ All Items (visible in all work areas) at any time to switch to the Item List.
If youâ€™ve recently run a search and not cleared the results, the results of your last search may display in the Item List.
Tap Clear Search Results to start a new search.

Note: Users with appropriate access levels can find items to get more information about an item, add or remove inventory for an item, or make individual or bulk make changes to items.

title: Prepare Your Inventory and Menu Items for DeliverMe Online Ordering
content:
Last Updated: 
					    				March 12, 2024
Compatible Version: 8.310
As you plan what inventory and menu items youâ€™re going to offer through your DeliverMe online ordering site, here are a few things to keep in mind: Do your items pack up and travel well? Do you want to offer items a la carte or as combinations? Do you have appealing photos of your items to include online? Do items have helpful descriptions to anticipate your customers questions? How do modifiers (if any) work with your menu items?
Your DeliverMe online ordering site is a flexible, easy to use platform for you and your customers. Easily add and remove items from your online ordering site, manage orders as they are seamlessly queued in DeliverMe, and start and stop ordering as needed to manage your day to day sales.

Your site, set up by your Support team, will have a unique site address for your business. Information about your business is a mix of static and changing information.

Site header imageÂ  â€“ Up to 1200 pixels by 1200 pixels. Uploaded by Support.
Site logoÂ â€“ Up to 800 pixels by 800 pixels. Uploaded by Support.
Pickup and Delivery hours* â€“ Reflects the hours you set in Exatouch. Update in Exatouch > Settings > Register Preferences > Delivery tab.
Order Wait time* â€“ Reflects the Order Build time you set in Exatouch. If you have set two different build times, the longer build time is shown here. Update in Exatouch > Settings > Register Preferences > Delivery tab.
Note: If a customer views your site when delivery or pickup hours are closed (scheduled or temporary), this is replaced by a message that ASAP orders are not available. Customers can place an order for a future available date and time.
Note: If a customer views your site when delivery or pickup hours are closed (scheduled or temporary), this is replaced by a message that ASAP orders are not available. Customers can place an order for a future available date and time.
Location Address â€“ Defined in Exatouch > Settings > Business Details by Support.
More Info* â€“ This link opens an information pop up with more detailed information about your scheduled delivery hours, pickup hours, and wait times. Update in Exatouch > Settings > Register Preferences > Delivery tab.
Location Phone Number â€“ Defined in Exatouch > Settings > Business Details by Support.
Order Minimum* â€“ Reflects the Min. Order you set in Exatouch. Update in Exatouch > Settings > Register Preferences > DeliverMe tab.
Delivery Fee* â€“ Reflects the Delivery Fee you set in Exatouch. Update in Exatouch > Settings > Register Preferences > Delivery tab > DeliverMe Preferences.
Menu Categories* â€“ These reflect the categories items you offer online.
Note: Starred (*) fields updated in Exatouch push to your online ordering site where applicable within a minute or two of you saving your changes. Changes you make do not affect orders currently in the order queues.
You can flexibly offer as few or as many menu or retail items you have set up in your Exatouch system. Our support team can help you plan your rollout as you decide what to offer firstâ€”then you can add items at your own pace.
All item information is pulled from your Item Details record (Home > Items > Item Details > Details tab). Most of the information you need is already there, and weâ€™ve added a toggle you can use (Make Available Online?) to control the itemâ€™s online availability.
Caution: Before you make significant changes to your items in Exatouch, make a backup of your database.
Some fields for your items may be mostly ready to put online. Some may have limited information, in an easy shorthand for your staff.Â Use the handy guide here to understand which fields you can update before (and after) you offer an item on your DeliverMe online ordering site.
Example:  An item with an Item NameÂ such asÂ Ahi-app should be updated to a customer-friendly name like Ahi Tuna, and given a description of Blackened tuna served rare, wasabi creme fraiche, sweet soy-chili glaze and scallions.

To ease the transition for your customers, use the familiar names and descriptions they are used to seeing when they visit you in person. Pick up descriptions from your menu, or briefly describe important features of retail items, such as color and content.
Item Name*Â â€“ The brand or friendly name of an item.
Description* â€“ A longer description of an item, such as the ingredients, toppings, or uses.
Price* â€“ The retail price of the item before fees and taxes are applied.
Category â€“ The category this item is grouped by. The order of categories can be changed in your online ordering site after youâ€™ve loaded your items.
Image â€“ This is the image, max 800 pixels by 800 pixels, of an item. See the section Image Management in this article.
Make Available Online?*Â â€“ Enable to make an item available online. Disable to remove the item for sale online.
Item is a Modifier â€“ See the section Manage ModifiersÂ in this article.
Sticky Label Print Description*Â â€“ A short friendly item name you print on a sticky label to affix to a specific item, such as Vegetarian Sub or Onion Soup. This helps you match and manage all items in an order.
Age Check* â€“ Select yes to prompt for an age check on this item. Select no to skip an age check for this item.
Item Name*Â â€“ The brand or friendly name of an item.
Description* â€“ A longer description of an item, such as the ingredients, toppings, or uses.
Price* â€“ The retail price of the item before fees and taxes are applied.
Category â€“ The category this item is grouped by. The order of categories can be changed in your online ordering site after youâ€™ve loaded your items.
Image â€“ This is the image, max 800 pixels by 800 pixels, of an item. See the section Image Management in this article.
Make Available Online?*Â â€“ Enable to make an item available online. Disable to remove the item for sale online.
Item is a Modifier â€“ See the section Manage ModifiersÂ in this article.
Sticky Label Print Description*Â â€“ A short friendly item name you print on a sticky label to affix to a specific item, such as Vegetarian Sub or Onion Soup. This helps you match and manage all items in an order.
Age Check* â€“ Select yes to prompt for an age check on this item. Select no to skip an age check for this item.
Note: Starred (*) fields updated in Exatouch push to your online ordering site where applicable within a minute or two of you saving your changes. Changes you make do not affect orders currently in the DeliverMe queues.

Your DeliverMe online ordering site includes a header image, your logo image, and images for each item.
Header image:Â  An image you provide to Support can be up to 1200 pixels by1200 pixels. Use it to showcase your business, highlight specialty items, and make your customers feel welcome.
Logo image: The image you provide to Support can be up to 800 pixels by 800 pixels. It is shared on your online ordering site alongside your other business information, and assures your return customers they are ordering from your DeliverMe online ordering site.
Menu Item and Inventory Images: For best results, select attractive, representative images 800px by 800px in size.
As you update items in Exatouch to build out your DeliverMe online ordering site, youâ€™ll be able to add images for each item. Your items are organized online by category; to make keeping track of each images easier, group your items in folders based on category. Use a readable name for each item, such as beer-bottle-bud.jpg, enchilada-dinner.png, and cool-ranch-dorito-20oz.jpg.
To add images to your items listed in DeliverMe online ordering site, log in as administrator, and update each item by dragging and dropping each image on each item record.
Log in to your DeliverMe site as the administrator.
Tap or click your name to open the site navigation menu.
Tap or clickÂ Settings. A DeliverMe merchant settings work area opens.
Tap or clickÂ Category and Item Management, then navigate to an item.
Click and drag your itemâ€™s image to the Drop 800Ã—800 image here. Youâ€™ll be able to see the image before you save your work and make it available online.
Tap or clickÂ Save Item to save the image for this item.
Repeat as needed for each item.


The modifiers and modifier groups youâ€™ve set up for your menu items in Exatouch are available in your DeliverMe online ordering site. All of the modifier information is pulled from your Item Details record (Home > Items > Item Details > Details tab). Most of the information you need is already there.

Caution: Before you make significant changes to your items in Exatouch, make a backup of your database.

Some fields for your modifiers may be ready to put online. Some may have limited information, in an easy shorthand for your staff. Use the handy guide here to understand which fields you can update before (and after) you offer an item on your DeliverMe online ordering site.

Item Name*Â â€“ The brand or friendly name of an item.
Price* â€“ The retail price, if any, of the item before fees and taxes are applied.
Note: Starred (*) fields updated in Exatouch push to your online ordering site where applicable within a minute or two of you saving your changes. Changes you make do not affect orders currently in the DeliverMe queues.
Note: Starred (*) fields updated in Exatouch push to your online ordering site where applicable within a minute or two of you saving your changes. Changes you make do not affect orders currently in the DeliverMe queues.
The other fields that affect your modifiers include:
Category â€“ Mods. The category must be Mods and attached to your items as needed to show up on your DeliverMe online ordering site.
Subcategory â€“ Usually the name of the modifier group for this item.
Item is a Modifier â€“ Enable to allow this item to be used as a modifier.
Make Available Online?*Â â€“ Disable, and leave disabled. The item will appear online as a modifier to an individual sale item.
Unlike your menu and inventory items, do not enable Make Available Online?. This item appears online as a modifier to an individual sale item, as needed.

title: Modify Bulk Services
content:
Last Updated: 
					    				September 25, 2023
Groups of Services can be modified in bulk, making price modification and category changes a breeze! Use the Modify All List Services function to accomplish these tasks.
Group a list of services together in the Service List module.Â Then use Modify All List Services to apply changes to the group.
FromÂ Home,Â navigate to Items > Service List.
Use the Search field or Advanced Services Search button to gather a group of services together.
View the services displayed, scrolling through the entire list to confirm that all services are intended.
Tap Modify All List Services.
Enter any changes. See a detailed list of options below.
TapÂ OK.
When prompted to confirm modifying all list services, clickÂ YesÂ to confirm.Â This prompt displays twice.
Enter an Admin PIN, if prompted, to finalize changes.
Changes display within each service record.


Price changes can be applied in bulk.Â Exatouch gives you the ability to either increase or decrease the price of a group of services in dollar increments or by percentage.
These are settings for bulk price changes:
Restaurant Scenario 1: A popular restaurant is increasing the price of its catering services by $10.Â The word â€œCateringâ€ is entered in the Search field to gather a list of catering services. Prices are increased by $10 per service item on the Modify All List Services tab using these settings. The merchant enters 10.00 in the Price field, then enables the plus sign (+) slider:


These options may be applied in bulk to a group of services:
Time:Â Â Scheduled time slots can be applied in bulk, which saves merchants valuable time.Example: A salon sets up times for various services so they can be scheduled effectively. They determine that all menâ€™s and boysâ€™ cuts take 15 minutes.Â Instead of applying a 15 minute slot to each individual service, generate a list of all menâ€™ and boysâ€™ cuts using Advanced Services Search.Â They use Modify All List Services to apply a 15 minute time unit to all those services.Â These are the settings applied:
Example: A salon sets up times for various services so they can be scheduled effectively. They determine that all menâ€™s and boysâ€™ cuts take 15 minutes.Â Instead of applying a 15 minute slot to each individual service, generate a list of all menâ€™ and boysâ€™ cuts using Advanced Services Search.Â They use Modify All List Services to apply a 15 minute time unit to all those services.Â These are the settings applied:
Price: Prices increase or decrease in dollar increments or percentage increments
Category
Subcategory
User Defined Reporting: Drive to report:Â Choose â€œBusiness Overview Reportâ€ and/or â€œSnapshot Reportsâ€ to display data for the selected list services.
Tax: Taxes can be applied in bulk to select services. Choose which tax group. General taxes, per unit taxes, and pre or post-taxes can be applied in bulk. Tax settings are defined in Settings. See:Â Set General TaxesÂ Example: Scenario 2: The state has enacted a new tax for all salon and spa services. Salons can easily apply this tax to all their services by using Modify All List Services. After displaying a list of all services in Services List, select Modify All List Services and apply Tax Group A:Â Florida Tax. These are the settings:
Example: Scenario 2: The state has enacted a new tax for all salon and spa services. Salons can easily apply this tax to all their services by using Modify All List Services. After displaying a list of all services in Services List, select Modify All List Services and apply Tax Group A:Â Florida Tax. These are the settings:
Visible on register
Display color
Refundable
Cash Discount: Enable cash discounting for a group of services by enabling this setting. See:Â Enable Cash Discounts

Tip!  Promos are easy to apply to a group of service items!Â Bulk Promos are a subset of Modify All List Services located on the Promo tab. After tapping Promo, configure bulk promo settings as desired. For more information on creating Item-Level Promos for service items, see:Â Create Item Level Promos
Note: Historical pricing allows merchants to view current and historical pricing, and can be applied to a group of services. Historical Pricing is a subset of Modify All List Services, located on the Historical Pricing tab. See:Â Historical Pricing
Also see: Modify Bulk Items

title: Add Modifiers to an Item
content:
Last Updated: 
					    				September 27, 2023
Once a modifier is created and defined, the modifier (aka mod) can be added to an item.
MODs can be added to a category of items, to a single item, or to all items.
From Home, navigate to Items > Item Details.
Tap the Details tab.
Verify that the correct record displays.Â If not, tap All Items to find another item.Â See:Â Find an Item
Tap theÂ ModifiersÂ tab.
Select a Category from the Categories list to add to the Modifies These Items section.Â Tap the Arrow to move your choice over to the list.Â For example, select Mods and move it to the Bleu Cheese Dip modifier list.
Merchants can also add Subcategories to the Modifies These Items section.Â Select a subcategory, and tap the Arrow to move it into the list.
Review theÂ Modifies These ItemsÂ list.
Remove items fromÂ the Modifies These Items list by selecting an item and tapping Delete.
Tap the Add button to add a one or several individual items to Modifies these items.Â See the instructionsÂ â€œAdd Modifiers to a Single Itemâ€ below.
TapÂ Save.


From theÂ Item Details page, tap the Modifiers tab. See:Â Find Modifier Details
Tap Add New Item.
Select one or more items from the list.Â Scroll or use search to narrow your choices, then tap Close.
View the added item(s).
Tap Save.


The MOD has now been added to an item.Â Now determine whether the modifier will appear as a required modifier or as an optional modifier.
See: Difference between a required and an optional modifier

If the mod will be required, see:Â Add Modifier to a Group.
If the mod will be optional, see:Â View Modifiers at the Register.

title: What is a Service Item?
content:
Last Updated: 
					    				March 10, 2021
A service itemÂ is a non-tangible, service-based product. Services have an element of time, a cost associated with the service, and a staff member who provides the service.
Following are examples of Service Providers and their services:
Salon and Spa: Salons/Spas may provide haircuts, coloring, highlights, blowouts. They also may include Massage and Esthetician services. Packages may include combinations of services. Each service item has a time frame, a cost, and a stylist who provides the service.
Bicycle Repair Shop: Bicycle repair shops provide repair services such as Tuneup package, Brake overhaul, Flat tire repair. Technicians provide these services in a specified amount of time.
Home Cleaning Service: Services may include Full-service cleaning, Deep cleaning, Apartment cleaning, Green cleaning, and/or Consultations and Assessments. Services are scheduled on specific days and times with one or more cleaning professionals.
See: Add a Service

title: Process Bottle Returns
content:
Last Updated: 
					    				November 7, 2023
In some states, customers who purchase beverages are charged a deposit for the bottle in addition to the retail price of the beverage. Customers return the empty bottle for a refund of the deposit. In Exatouch, the Bottle Calculator custom button automatically calculates bottle deposit refund amounts.
Perform the following to process a bottle return:

Begin by creating a bottle deposit description and entering refund amount.
From Home, navigate to Settings > Register Preferences.
Verify the General tab displays.
From the Default DRV drop-down menu, select a bottle return description.
When selecting the Miscellaneous DRV default setting, enter a refund amount (per bottle) in the Default Bottle Redeem field.
When selecting a custom bottle deposit type:
Tap the magnifying glass icon.
Select a description from the list of available bottle deposit types and tap OK.
The Price from the custom bottle deposit list automatically populates in the Default Bottle Redeem field.
Tap Save.


Creating a Bottle Calculator custom button allows merchants to quickly ring up bottle returns on the Register app.
From the Register Preferences screen, tap the Custom Buttons tab.
On the Custom Button screen, tap Buttons.
Select an available button from the grid. Available buttons are blank. Buttons can be cleared to make room for another function.
From the Function section, select Bottle Calculator. Scroll or enter keywords in the Search field.
View the assignment of Bottle Calculator to the grid, then tap Save.
On the Register Preferences screen, tap Save again.

Use the Bottle Calculator custom button you created to ring up bottle returns quickly and easily.
Navigate to the Register.
Tap the Bottle Calculator custom button.
When the Bottle Calculator displays, perform one of the following.
Verify the desired deposit displays and proceed to Step 4.
Tap the circled X to replace the pre-populated deposit with the default Miscellaneous DRV setting, or select a new deposit by tapping the magnifying glass icon.
Enter the the number of bottles in the Qty of bottles returned field or tap the plus (+) or minus (â€“) icons to calculate the bottle deposit refund value.
Tap Add to Order.
The Bottle Return value displays as a negative number in the order window and is reflected in the Total. Bottle Return values can be applied as credits toward a purchase or redeemed as a refund.


Generate a Bottle Return Details report to view a history of bottle return transactions.
From Home, navigate to Reports > Sales.
On the Sales Report screen, tap the bottle Return Details button.
Tip! Sometimes, the Sales Report screen may display in Advanced Report mode. If that happens, tap the Simple Report button to return to Simple Report mode.
View the Bottle Return Details report./li>

See: Process Bottle Deposits

title: Define Custom Variables
content:
Last Updated: 
					    				June 14, 2023
Custom variables allow you to edit multiple data fields throughout Exatouch. Details such as staff type, floor plan components, payout types, and transaction reasons can be defined as custom variables. Item details such as size, color, and style are defined for reporting purposes.

Custom variables are defined under Settings > Preferences. Each custom variable type has a unique set of requirements associated with it. The process of defining custom variables varies by type; some variables require information such as â€œunitâ€ to be assigned.
This is an example of how to define variables for the Item Color group:
FromÂ Home, navigate toÂ Settings > Preferences.
Tap theÂ Custom VarsÂ (custom variables) tab.
In the Type section, select Item Color, then tap Add Line to add colors.
Enter a new color.
Delete colors by tappingÂ DeleteÂ next to an entry.
Tap Save.

Tip! Check your work! Navigate to the Inventory tab on the Item Details page to view choices in theÂ Color drop-down menu.


Note: Custom variables can work in conjunction with custom buttons by defining functions used to create custom buttons. See: Difference between Custom Buttons and Custom Variables
Select a custom variable type to learn what custom variables can do for you:
Merchants can create user-defined fields to track items on a granular level. Under Items Details, there are three user-defined fields. Labels for these fields are assigned via custom variables. Once labels are defined, each label (maximum of 3) displays as a custom report in Sales Reports and/or Advanced Sales Reports. Additional steps are needed in order for user-defined reporting to be functional.
Example:Â In reviewing their menu offerings, a Mexican restaurant wants to determine which appetizers, entrees, and desserts areÂ the mostÂ popular.Â User-defined fields can be Appetizers, Entrees, and Desserts.
Impact:Â Item Details.Â  Look for the user-defined field drop-downs.Â  In order for reporting to be fully functional, drop-down content must be defined, and values need to be chosen.
Reports:Â Navigate to Reports > Sales, and find the names of reports you defined (maximum 3.)


Staff type describes an employeeâ€™s role. Create different staff roles to display on an employee profile via Custom Variables. Staff type is not related to access permissions in Exatouch.
Example:Â Cashier, Cook, Dishwasher, Manager
Impact:Â Staff Details. Look for the â€œStaff typeâ€ field on an employee record.
Reports:Â N/A
See: Create Staff TypesÂ andÂ Â Difference between Staff Type and User Type


Floor plans can be broken down into zones for organized management. Labels for â€œFloor Plan Zonesâ€ are defined via custom variables.
Example:Â Main Dining, Bar, Patio
Impact:Â Floor Plan Zone labels appear immediately after they are defined via custom variables.
Reports:Â N/A



Item size, color, and style are Item-level information used for reporting purposes and/or with Matrix Inventory.

See: Add Size OptionsÂ andÂ Add Color Options

Example:Â A shoe store describes their shoes using Item colors: beige, black, blue; Item size: womenâ€™s 5, womenâ€™s 6 â€¦ womenâ€™s 11; Item style: narrow, medium, wide.
Impact:Â Item Details, in the Size, Color and Style drop-downs.
Reports:Â Size, Color, and Style are included in the Sales Reports: Sales by Size, Sales by Color, Sales by Style, and Sales by Matrix. Items List has a â€œsizeâ€ column, and â€œAdvanced item searchâ€ can filter by size, color, and style.

Tip! Size, Color, and Style variables can also be updated on the Items Details page by tapping the â€œGEARâ€ icon next to each field.

Revenue Center and Revenue Class are item-level information used for detailed reporting purposes. Data from Revenue Center and Revenue Class fields are designed to display on Business Overview and Snapshot reports. While RevenueÂ center and Revenue class are separate criteria, they can be used together.
Example 1:Â Retail store uses Revenue Center to track overall liquor sales. Revenue Center: Liquor
Example 2:Â Retail store uses Revenue Center and Revenue Class together to track specific liquor sales. Revenue Center: Liquor; Revenue Class: Brandy, Rum, Vodka
Impact:Â Directly impacts Items Details. See Revenue Center and Revenue Class drop-downs. To fully benefit from Revenue center and class labels, labels need to be applied within Items Details.Tip! Revenue Center and Revenue Class can be edited directly by selecting the gear icon next to the field.
Tip! Revenue Center and Revenue Class can be edited directly by selecting the gear icon next to the field.
Reports:Â â€œBusiness Overview Reportâ€ and â€œSnapshot Reportsâ€


Item manufacturer data is used for reporting purposes which are unrelated to vendors or purchase orders.
Example 1:Â Retailers that deal in auto parts often use manufacturer part numbers and create manufacturer variables which correspond to part numbers.
Example 2:Â Firestone, Sumitomo, Goodyear.
Impact:Â Item Details. Look for the Manufacturer and Manufacturer Part # drop-down menus.Tip! Item manufacturer can be edited directly from Item Details by selecting the gear icon next to the field.
Tip! Item manufacturer can be edited directly from Item Details by selecting the gear icon next to the field.
Reports:Â Manufacturer details are displayed in Manufacturer Report and in Advanced Reports, located in Sales Reports.


Modifier Pages expand modifier offerings at the register. Modifier pages are often associated with ratios. Ratios must be defined as whole numbers. Pizzerias often use modifier pages to describe pizza toppings.
Example:Â A pizzeria defines the following modifier pages:

Whole Topping â€“ Ratio 100.00
1/2 Topping â€“ Ratio 50.00
1/4 Topping â€“ Ratio 25.00
Whole Topping â€“ Ratio 100.00
1/2 Topping â€“ Ratio 50.00
1/4 Topping â€“ Ratio 25.00

Impact:Â The Register, on orders with MODS. View Modifier Pages when the MOD window pops-up at the register. While Modifers Page labels appear immediately at the register, further steps are needed for full functionality.
Reports:Â N/A

See: How to Use Modifier PagesÂ and Organize Modifier Pages



Restaurants can assign custom labels to their courses.
Example:Â Beverages, Appetizers, Entree, Dessert
Impact:Â Coursing at the register. Select â€œCourse Seatsâ€ to add course entries, and view the course labels.
Reports:Â N/A

Note: Course labels are used in conjunction with course firing. For full functionality, enable printer preferences for course firing.Â  See: Setup Course Firing Printer Preferences and Rename Restaurant Courses

Instructions provide additional detail on applying MODS to an order. This is especially helpful to restaurants who communicate specific instructions to kitchen staff before an order is prepared. Up to 8 custom Instruction variables can be defined.
Example:Â An Italian restaurant applies these instructions to clarify their modifiers: Extra $, Add $. Associated modifiers include: Olives, Onions, Peppers. A customer orders a â€œHouse Saladâ€ with â€œExtraâ€ + â€œOlives.â€ â€œExtraâ€ is an instruction on how to apply â€œOlives.â€
Impact:Â The Register, when a MOD is added to the order. Instructions appear as GREEN buttons in the MOD section. Note the total price difference when adding Optional Modifiers, such as Extra Bacon.
Reports:Â N/A

Tip! Donâ€™t forget to double-tap â€œAll Modifiersâ€ to clear the instruction button after selections are complete.
See: Create Instruction Modifiers

Track pre-defined reasons for voids and refunds in reports. These fields are optional but can be set to â€œrequiredâ€ in Settings.
Example:Â Incorrect Price, Damaged Item
Impact:Â The Register. Refund is located on the Global Menu by default. Orders can be voided from the Open orders window. When a refund is processed, the user is prompted to enter a refund reason. When a void is processed, the user is prompted to enter a reason for the void.
Reports:Â â€œRefund/Void Report,â€ located under Reports > Sales.


Track instances of company pay-ins for reporting purposes.
Example 1:Â A convenience store returns unsold magazines to the vendor for reimbursement. â€œVendor Reimbursementâ€ is considered a â€œCompany Pay In.â€
Example 2:Â Change (i.e. nickels, dimes, quarters) from a company payout can be considered a company pay in â€“ â€œPayout Changeâ€
Impact:Â The Register. Company pay ins are processed on the Order Details tab at the Register. When pay ins are processed, merchants are prompted to select a reason for the pay in.
Reports:Â â€œPay in/out Report,â€ located under Reports > Sales.


Track reasons for company payouts on reports.
Examples:Â Inventory, Supplies, Expenses
Impact:Â The Register. Company payouts are processed on the Order Details tab at the Register. When payouts are processed, merchants are prompted to select a reason for the payout.
Reports:Â â€œPay in/out Report,â€ located under Reports > Sales.


Track reasons for customer payouts on reports.
Example:Â Lottery, Events, Promotions
Impact:Â The Register. When customer payouts are processed, merchants are prompted to select a payout reason.
Reports:Â â€œPay in/out Report,â€ located in Sales Reports

See: Process Customer PayoutsÂ andÂ Setup Quick Payout



This variable helps merchants sell â€œby-fractionâ€ items while deducting the weight of the container (aka tare weight). Container weight is an Item-level variable, and each container type is assigned a weight and a unit.
Example:Â An ice cream store sells different size ice cream cups by weight. They donâ€™t want to include the container weight in their sales, so â€œContainer Weightâ€ variables are created for different types of containers, each corresponding to weight and unit: SM/0.1000/lb, MED/0.2000/lb, LG/0.3000/lb.
Impact:Â The Register. When a â€œsold by fractionâ€ item is rung up, container weight options pop-up for selection.Tip! A â€œNew Containerâ€ variable can be created directly from the Select Container pop-up.
Tip! A â€œNew Containerâ€ variable can be created directly from the Select Container pop-up.
Reports:Â N/A

Note: â€œSold-by-fractionâ€ weight and â€œContainer Weightâ€ need to be the same for proper functionality. If these weights are different, container weight will not display at the Register.

Allows restaurants to display custom order types which are displayed on kitchen receipts, informing kitchen staff how to prepare an order. Custom order type can be set to default at the time of setup.
Each Custom Order variable is assigned an order â€œType.â€ Each order type has a set of characteristics:
Dine In:Â does not require customer info, no delivery address
Take Out:Â requires customer info, no delivery address
Pick Up:Â requires customer info
Delivery:Â requires customer info and a valid delivery address; Delivery orders can be used with the Delivery Manager
Example:Â Restaurants with call-in orders create these custom order types: Pick Up, Delivery, Delivery Service.
Impact:Â Custom Buttons and the Register. After Custom Order Types are defined within custom variables, order types become available to assign as custom buttons. Once assigned as custom buttons, order types display at the register.
Reports:Â â€œBusiness Overviewâ€ and â€œSnapshot Reports.â€ See â€œSales by Order typeâ€ section in each report.

Note: â€œSold-by-fractionâ€ weight and â€œContainer Weightâ€ need to be the same for proper functionality. If these weights are different, container weight will not display at the Register.

Special instructions are used with MODS at the register. This is helpful for restaurants wishing to provide additional information for the kitchen staff. Up to 14 special instruction variables can be defined.

Tip! Special Instructions do not change the application of a MOD at the Register; they simply convey a message to kitchen staff

Example:Â Gluten Allergy, Peanut Allergy, Vegan
Impact:Â The Register, when MODS are added. Special instructions appear on BLUE buttons in the Modifiers section.
Reports:Â N/A

Note: â€œSold-by-fractionâ€ weight and â€œContainer Weightâ€ need to be the same for proper functionality. If these weights are different, container weight will not display at the register.
See: Create Special Instruction Modifiers

title: Advantages of Setting Up Multiple SKUs For an Item
content:
Last Updated: 
					    				March 10, 2021
Setting up multiple SKUs for an item allows you to track items more efficiently. Use sales trends to make informed purchasing decisions.
Example:  You sell several special editions of a liquor which have the same volume, contents, and SKU number assigned by the manufacturer.
Use Exatouch to assign an Alternate SKU to items bearing the same Manufacturer SKU number, then use these Alternate SKUs to track sales for each edition. Reference the sales information broken down by special edition to make an informed decision about repurchasing special edition items.

title: Generate SKU Numbers and Assign Alternate SKU Numbers
content:
Last Updated: 
					    				March 10, 2021
Compatible Version: 8.286+Does your Exatouch look different? View prior release â†’
The Stock Keeping Unit (SKU) is a multi-digit number assigned to inventory and menu items. Exatouch supports EAN-13, EAN-8, UPC-A, and UPC-E compliant barcodes.
Use Exatouch to generate a SKU for any item, or assign an Alternate SKU to items to sell multiple versions of an item.


Find and open an existing item to edit. Alternatively, start a new item record.
Tap to select the Details tab.
Tap the SKU button next to the SKU field to generate a UPC-A (12 digit) or UPC-E (8 digit) number.
Tap the SKU button again to switch between a generated UPC-A or UPC-E number.
TapÂ Save to save your changes.



Example: Your beverage vendor delivers several cases of a special edition soda that differs from an existing item only by barcode and packaging images.

Find and open an existing item to edit. Alternatively, start a new item record.
Tap to select the Inventory Options tab.
Tap an empty SKU field in theÂ Alternate SKU work area and enter or scan the desired SKU or barcode.
Tap theÂ Description field to enter the description for the added SKU, if needed.
TapÂ SaveÂ after completing all changes on theÂ Inventory OptionsÂ tab.
Tap a SKU number or Description to change it, or Delete to remove an Alternate SKU.

title: Duplicate Items and Modifiers
content:
Last Updated: 
					    				January 4, 2024
Compatible Version: 8.286+Does your Exatouch look different? View prior release â†’
Save time and effort adding new items by duplicating and editing an existing item or modifier.
Duplicating existing items allows merchants to quickly build their menu without having to build individual items and items with modifiers from scratch.
For example, a merchant creating a new Angus Burger in Exatouch wants it to retain the same modifiers as other burgers on the menu. This can be accomplished by using the Duplicate button under Item Details.

From Home, navigate to Items > Item List.
Select an item to duplicate from the Item List screen.
On the Item Details screen, tap Duplicate.
Perform the following:
SKU: Enter or generate a new SKU.
Item Name: Enter a name (e.g. Angus Burger) for the duplicated item.
Price:: Enter a price for the duplicated item, if desired.
Description (Optional): Enter any other description information for the duplicated item.
Tap Save.
Check Your Work: Navigate to the Register, select the recently duplicated item, and verify modifiers also display for that item.
SKU and Alternate SKU fields display as blank when duplicating an item.
Other fields possibly requiring adjustment include the following:
Vendor Name and Part Number fields
Stock Locations and Inventory fields
Promo, Sale, and Discount settings


Duplicating modifiers also helps merchants save time when creating a menu or expanding a menu in Exatouch. For example, a merchant can add Cajun Fries as an optional side for all entrees that already offer Onion Rings as a side.
From the Item List screen, select a modifier to duplicate.
On the Item Details screen, tap Duplicate.
Perform the following:
Enter a new SKU number.
In the Item Name field, enter a name for the new modifier (e.g., Cajun Fries).
Enter a new price, if necessary.
Tap Save.
Check Your Work: Navigate to the Register app and enter an item. The itemâ€™s newly duplicated modifier displays in the Sides column.

Tip! Merchants can also limit the number of modifiers allowed for a root item by adjusting the Modifier Limit setting. See: Enable Modifier Limits.

title: Low Level Quantities in the Register
content:
Last Updated: 
					    				May 7, 2024
Compatible Version: 8.286+Does your Exatouch look different? View prior release â†’
Use Exatouch to manage and monitor your inventory. Use the Inventory work area of Item Details to view and manage your inventory items, set quantity defaults and alerts, as well as manage details about the items you carry in stock.
Set a low level quantity threshold, and optionally trigger an alert when inventory dips below that level. This alert pops up in the Register app as a visual reminder to reorder this item.
Note: This article explains how to define low level quantity alerts in the Register app. For low level quantity alerts for Purchase Orders, see: Low Level Quantities for Purchase Orders.
FromÂ Home, navigate to Items > Item List.
Select an item to open the itemâ€™sÂ Item DetailsÂ work area.
Tap the Inventory tab to open the Inventory work area.
In the Stock Type section, tap Inventory Item to enable inventory fields.
On the itemâ€™s Item Details screen, enter a low inventory threshold in the Low Level Qty field for the item.
If inventory falls below this threshold, it is returned in reports and searches based on low level and reorder needs.
IfÂ Alert is enabled, users are notified in the Register app when inventory drops below the low level quantity threshold on an item in an order.
Optionally, defineÂ Reorder Qty, Minimum Order Qty, and Case Qty.
Tap Save.

Note: To enable low level quantity alerts in the Register app, the item must first be associated with a vendor. See: Set Default Vendor for an Item.

On the itemâ€™s Item Details screen, enable the Alert (Inventory Items only) slider to alert users in the Register app when inventory drops below the Low Level Qty threshold.
Tap Save.
Create an order in the Register app. If an itemâ€™s quantity falls below the Low Level Qty value, an alert displays in the Register.

See: Create a Purchase Order andÂ Modify Inventory Levels
